description: Sets the color of foreground elements; typically used along with a function or color value to set the color of text.
Sets the color of an element's background.
Long-hand border property. Sets the color of an element's border.
Specifies a background image to be used as an element's background. Can take an image url or a linear gradient function.
Sets the text's primary and backup font family if not available.
Sets the text attribute as bold or italicized.
Specifies the weight or degree of thickness of a font.
Applies transformations, such as uppercase, to text.
Modifies the appearance of text. Can be used to add underline, dotted or wavy decorations, etc.
Used to set the size of font in pixels (px) or em.
CSS rule used to specify the location of an installed font.
Determines the spacing between characters.
Sets additional spacing (whitespace) between words.
Determines the vertical area of a text box.
Sets the default width in pixels or percent of an element's content-box relative to its parent.
Sets the default height in pixels or percent of an element's content-box relative to its parent.
Sets the maximum or minimum width of an element's content box. Useful when the viewports can be resized.
Sets the maximum or minimum height of an element's content box.
Sets the margins (the space outside of the border) for an element.
Sets the padding (the space inside of the border) for an element.
Determines the type of box to be used for an element.
Along with the left, right, top, and bottom properties, determines how an element is positioned within the flow of a document.
Sets the display property of the element to a grid container. Required to define additional CSS grid properties.
Shorthand property for grid-template-rows and grid-template-columns. Sets the number and width/height of grid rows followed by columns.
Sets the number and height of grid rows. The example creates 3 rows: The first is 60px tall. The second is 2/3 the remaining space. The third is 1/3 the remaining space.
Sets the number and width of grid columns. The example creates 4 identical columns, each with a width of 50px.
Sets the gutter space between grid rows and columns. Shorthand property for row-gap and column-gap.
Sets the gutter space between grid rows.
Sets the gutter space between grid columns.

Shorthand property for grid-row-start and grid-row-end or grid-column-start and grid-column-end. Specifies how many grid lines a row will span. The first value specifies the row start. The second value specifies the row end.
Specifies the starting grid line for a grid row or column item. The example describes a grid item that starts at row line 1 which is immediately before the first row begins.
Specifies the terminal grid line for a grid row item or grid-column-item. The example ends at grid row line 5, immediately before but not inclusive of row 5.
Shorthand property for grid-row and grid-column. The order is: row start, column start, row end, then column end.
